attr.pathogenesis: shortened skull and facial structure leading to airway obstruction
attr.complications: bronchial collapse, gastroesophageal reflux, heart strain

attr.limitations: risks of anesthesia in compromised patients

attr.method: surgical amputation of part of soft palate

reference: Riecks, T. W., Birchard, S. J., & Stephens, J. A. (2007). Surgical correction of brachycephalic syndrome in dogs: 62 cases (1991-2004). Journal of the American Veterinary Medical Association, 230(9), 1324-1328; Staphylectomy for Elongated Soft Palate - Veterinary Surgery Online. (n.d.). Retrieved from https://www.vetsurgeryonline.com/elongated-soft-palate/

attr.risks: reduced bleeding and swelling compared to traditional methods

reference: Riecks, T. W., Birchard, S. J., & Stephens, J. A. (2007). Surgical correction of brachycephalic syndrome in dogs: 62 cases (1991-2004). Journal of the American Veterinary Medical Association, 230(9), 1324-1328; Staphylectomy for Elongated Soft Palate - Veterinary Surgery Online. (n.d.). Retrieved from https://www.vetsurgeryonline.com/elongated-soft-palate/

attr.risks: short-term relief only, side effects with long-term use
